description:
Adient Aerospace is a Joint Venture between Adient and Boeing. Boeing brings a deep knowledge of Aerospace, and Adient is the world’s leader in automotive seating. At Adient Aerospace, it is our mission to deliver innovative seating design through precise operational excellence, resulting in a superior customer experience. We bring the right pieces together, in precisely the right way, at precisely the right time.

Adient Aerospace is looking for a Supply Chain Integrator to join our team in Huntington Beach, California. This is an on-site role and must be based in Huntington Beach, CA. We look for highly proficient individuals who are collaborative, value diversity, enjoy working as a team, and share our passion to succeed. We invest in our employees with opportunities for professional development and we offer competitive benefits.

Are you the right piece to complete our puzzle?

Job Summary

The Supply Chain Integrator will serve as the primary point of contact within Supply Chain for their respective program, at an IPT Lead level, and will be responsible for managing the technical and programmatic aspects of the project, including cost, schedule, and quality.

SUMMARY OF JOB DUTIES - Essential Functions (Other duties and projects may be assigned or requested.)

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions

  • Manages COTD for the assigned program deliverables, includes new contracts and production.
  • Partners with other IPT leads, program managers, and customers to establish technical requirements, develop project plans, and identify risks and opportunities.
  • Facilitates and monitors cost reduction activities directly related to the program and suppliers
  • Supports product cost, performance, schedule, and quality objectives.
  • Develops and maintains project schedules, budgets, and performance metrics to track progress and identify areas for improvement.
  • Drives conversations, expectations, and activities to meet all program milestones
  • Establishes and executes feasible material schedules that are in alignment with engineering and production availability requirements, in accordance with program milestones.
  • Meets Bill of Material (BOM) cost objectives, coordinates schedules, and supplier product development.
  • Assesses and evaluates all Engineering Change Notice (ECN) changes that impact program schedules.
  • Cascades Master Scheduler forecasting actions to support first builds and ECN changes into production.
  • Works on daily and future shortages with purchasing and production to meet weekly ship-set delivery commitments. In addition, provide daily support to Program Managers.
  • Oversees “Line of Balance” analysis to support program long lead buys (Customer Sponsored Orders).
  • Oversees schedule revisions according to the qualification plan, established priorities, and availability of parts & material.
  • Collaborates with all functions to ensure buy in and adherence to the production schedule.
  • Updates the organization on material flow impact of schedule changes.
  • Drives transaction discipline that ensures materials are available to support the build schedule.
  • Ensures compliance with industry company standards and procedures, including safety, quality, and security.
  • Leads supply chain schedules and key supply chain actions with suppliers and operations team.
  • Produces and provides Supply Chain “Risk” analysis to program team and leading cross functional team to resolve in a timely manner.
  • Ensures purchasing execution is in alignment with program requirements, with primary responsibility of ensuring purchasing program support, supplier on time delivery (SOTD) and cost management.
  • Interfaces with purchasing agents and subcontract suppliers on delivery schedule, cost and contract inquiries
  • Supports Supplier Development in capacity and capability assessment of key program suppliers.
  • Assesses and evaluation of engineering changes to account for supply chain liability and communication of changes to Purchasing team.
  • Support emergency purchasing and on-site needs as required.

Education

GENERAL QUALIFICATIONS – Education, Knowledge, and Experience

  • A High School Diploma or equivalent is required.
  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in Business or Supply Chain Management is preferred. A combination of related experience and education may be considered in lieu of a Bachelor’s degree.

Experience

  • 3 - 5+ years of direct related experience.

Skills

  • Effective communications skills, both verbally and written.
  • Intermediate/proficient knowledge Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Strong written and verbal business communications abilities. Must be comfortable delivering information to all levels of the organization including senior leadership.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with employees from all levels of the organization.
  • Ability to provide information regarding tasks, plans, schedule, and strategy to stakeholders.
  • Customer service oriented.
  • Self-starter with ability to drive improvement, meet timeliness and objectives.

Preferred Skills/Experience

  • Previous program or project management experience
  • Previous Supply Chain experience
  • Knowledge of program launch processes.
  • Can prioritize Strategic vs. Tactical tasks and align to customer impact..

Other

  • May be asked to work extended or irregular hours as required.
  • Must show proof of ability to work in the United States.
  • Adient Aerospace is an “at-will” employer; employment is at the mutual consent of both the employee and the employer, and may be terminated at will for any reason, with or without cause, at any time during employment with the Company.
  • As business conditions warrant a change in the operating necessities of the Company, all employees are expected to react productively, handle other essential tasks assigned now or in the future.

Compensation / Benefits

Adient Aerospace offers competitive wages and benefits to recognize employees for their work. The base pay offered will vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, location, experience and take into account internal equity.

Salary Range Transparency: $94,960 - $130,570 annually

Featured Benefits

  • Up to 7% bonus potential (for bonus eligible positions)
  • Generous 401(K) matching with immediate eligibility and vesting
  • 3 weeks of Paid Time Off
  • 12 paid holidays
  • Affordable health care plans for yourself and your family
  • And so much more!

Other Perks

  • On-site gym
  • Free electric car charging stations
  • Potential for growth within organization
  • Supportive workplace environment with a team-oriented culture
